metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5209 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An Information Disclosure vulnerability exists in NTP 4.2.7p25 private (mode 6/7) messages via a GET_RESTRICT control message, which could let a malicious user obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
sntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> mode 7 is disabled by default in 4.2.8, marking relevant releases as not-affected

criterions.comment: ntp package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4').
